publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-751 Bill Wilson: Arms Sales and Culpability—That the Parliament believes that, where governments, banks and lending institutions have lent money to oppressive dictatorships for the purchase of weapons, the heads of these governments, banks and lending institutions and those of the industries that sold these arms, should be held criminally liable for the deaths, injuries and human rights violations connected with such weapons in those countries in the same way as the heads of the regimes involved. Supported by: Michael Matheson*, Bill Kidd*
